Danachi, population 8000, is a village in Zaqatala. It lines in the north-west part of Azerbaijan, situated on the bank of the Alazan river. From the 14th century, the Avarians been the main ethnic group living in this village. There is a good road between this village and the regional center in
. In Danachi, there are nice gardens, green forests, and creeks.
If you go to the bazaar bus station, there are 3-4 busses each day to go straight to Danachi.  You can also take the Uzunqazma andhi Ashagi Chardaklar busses and stop in Danachi.
If you go by taxi, it would cost 5 AZN for the whole taxi and .8 AZN for a seat.

value: content=You can go fishing on the Alazan river.
content=In the middle of the village, there is a large mosque that was constructed in 1910 by the local people without an engineer.
The people of Danachi grow tobaco, mint, nuts, and grain. There are also apples, pears, dates, apricots, and plum trees also.
The people in the village are famous for surfulu, a soup that has dried meat and hand made noodles.

in Zaqatala.  If you go to
city you can take the bus from the bazaar, from the village of
you can walk to the waterfall.
